stream-periods-tooltip: The amount of tokens sent from sender to receiver in a stream until it is updated or deleted. For example, if I create a stream on day 1, update it on day 3, and delete it on day 5, I will have generated 2 distinct stream periods: one between creation and update, and another between the update and deletion. Read more
events-help-alert: A timeline of events emitted by contracts that are related to the current address. Read more
super-token-help-alert: A super token is either a wrapper around existing ERC20 token or a custom token that has special properties which allow them to be streamed and distributed to many accounts at the same time. Read more
subscriptions-tooltip: Accounts that have received units within the Index. Subscribers will receive distributed funds based on the portion of units they own in and index. Read more
flow-rate: Flow rate is the velocity of tokens being streamed.
streams-help-alert: Stream represents super token flow between a sender and a receiver. Sender accounts can create, update, and delete streams, while receiver accounts can delete streams. However, a pair of addresses may only have one stream open per token (but this stream may be updated at any time by the sender). Read more
totalUnits: The sum of total pending and approved units issued to subscribers.
index: A pool of subscribers, each of which who holds a given number of units in the index.An index is created by a publisher who may update the index or distribute funds to the index using the Instant Distribution Agreement (IDA).
gda-pool-table-total-units-tooltip: The sum of total pending and approved units issued to members.
members-tooltip: Accounts that have received flows/units within the Pool. Members will receive distributed funds based on the portion of units they own in and pool. Read more
gda-admin-tooltip: The creator of an pool using the GDA - admins may update the pool of members and flow/distribute funds to members. Read more
gda-connected-tooltip: Indicates if account has claimed all past distributions and automatically claims all future distributions.
flow-distributions-tooltip: An event in which super tokens are stream to the entire pool of members for a given pool using the Superfluid GDA. Read more
distributions-tooltip: An event in which super tokens are distributed to the entire pool of members for a given pool using the Superfluid GDA. Read more
gda-pool-units-tooltip: Amount of units compared to the total pool. Funds will be distributed depending on the portion of units an account has. Read more
pool-admin-tooltip: The creator of an pool using the GDA - admins may update the pool of members and distribute funds to members. Read more
pool-address-tooltip: The ID which is associated with each pool in the General distribution agreement - this address is created when a admin creates an pool. Read more
total-connected-units-tooltip: Units that have claimed all past distributions and will automatically claim all future distributions.
total-disconnected-units-tooltip: Units that have not claimed their distribution yet.
admin-tooltip: The creator of an pool using the GDA - admins may update the pool of members and distribute funds to members. Read more
pool-id-tooltip: The ID which is associated with each pool in the General distribution agreement - this address is created when a admin creates an pool. Read more
flows-tooltip: An event in which super tokens are flow to the entire pool of members for a given pool using the Superfluid GDA. Read more
approved-tooltip: Indicates if account has claimed all past distributions and automatically claims all future distributions.
pool-members-tooltip: Accounts that have received units within the Pool. Subscribers will receive distributed funds based on the portion of units they own in and pool. Read more
units-tooltip: Amount of units compared to the total pool. Funds will be distributed depending on the portion of units an account has. Read more
approval-tooltip: Indicates if account has claimed all past distributions and automatically claims all future distributions.
